Title: NIS warns Nigerians against misusing US visas
Summary: NIS warns Nigerians against misusing US visas . The Nigeria Immigration Service has warned Nigerians to use their visas in strict compliance with the stated purpose of their application .

Title: Wike sued over alleged revocation of Abuja tech village plots
Summary: A group of investors under the aegis of Abuja Technology Village Free Trade Zone has filed a suit at the Federal High Court, Abuja .

Title: FCT: Nimi Hills offers smart living option as Guzape’s urban growth accelerates
Summary: Abuja’s urban sprawl continues its steady push beyond the traditional city centre . Developers and investors alike are turning their gaze to Nimi Hills .

Title: 573 Jigawa APC members defect to PDP
Summary: About 573 members of the All Progressives Congress (APC) in Jigawa State have defected to the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), as opposition .

Title: Cow attacks, injures staff at Government House Asaba
Summary: Cow attacked a staff member, causing panic among workers at Government House Asaba . Cow was meant for slaughter and went on a rampage and injured several people .

Title: Force PRO Olumuyiwa Adejobi promoted to Deputy Commissioner of Police
Summary: Adejobi was first appointed in acting capacity on 16th February 2022 as a CSP . He took over from then CP Frank Mba .

Title: Katsina varsity expels 57 students over exam malpractice
Summary: Katsina varsity expels 57 students over exam malpractice . It added that before taking the decision, the committee had earlier investigated infractions across multiple faculties .

Title: Zoning presidency unconstitutional, Gbenga Hashim faults Prof Jerry Gana
Summary: National Coordinator of Gbenga Hashim Solidarity Movement, Abdulrazaq Hamzat, has countered recent comments made by elder Statesman and former Minister of Information, Professor Jerry Gana . Professor Gana, during a recent national television appearance, said the PDP's 2027 presidential ticket should be given to the South .

Title: 17 Southern states youths demand unconditional release of Nnamdi Kanu
Summary: Youths of 17 Southern states demand unconditional release of Nnamdi Kanu . Tell FG to establish the Special National Ethnic Communities Peace and Development Commission .

Title: Dangote Refinery appoints David Bird new CEO
Summary: Executives have also confirmed plans to list the refining arm on both the London and Lagos stock exchanges . Dangote Refinery appoints David Bird new CEO .

Title: Benin group seeks rotational chairmanship in proposed traditional rulers council
Summary: The bill aims to establish a Nigerian Council of Traditional Rulers, but the group wants the Ooni of Ife and the Sultan of Sokoto to be permanent co-chairmen . The group said such a plan was to “undermine or diminish” the authority of the Oba of Benin .

Title: Yar’adua varsity expels 57 students over exam malpractice
Summary: The Senate of Umaru Musa Yar’adua University, Katsina, has approved the expulsion of about 57 students over involvement in various forms of examination malpractice . The decision came during the Senate’s 125th Regular Meeting, following recommendations from the University Central Examination Misconduct Committee . Five other students were rusticated

Title: Young Catholics converge on Rome for Pope Leo's vigil
Summary: Thousands of young Catholics gather for final Mass with Pope Leo XIV in Rome's Tor Vergata neighbourhood . Final Mass on August 3, 2025, just over two months after he became the head of the Catholic Church and the first American Pope . Title: Ukrainian drone strikes kill three in Russia
Summary: Ukrainian drone strikes killed three people and wounded two others overnight in western Russia, regional governors said on Saturday . One woman was killed and two other people were wounded in an attack on an enterprise in Penza . An elderly man was killed inside a house that caught fire due to falling drone debris in the Samara region, Governor Vyaches

Title: Naira loses 19 kobo against dollar at official market
Summary: The Naira lost 19 kobo against the U.S. dollar at the official market, trading at N1,533.74 on Friday . Data released on the official website of the Central Bank of Nigeria showed that the currency was slightly weaker on Thursday .
